page.title: 13RELIGION - KILMERSDON
page.content: The Parish Church of St Peter and St Paul - the only place of worship. It is a fine building of perpendicular Gothic with substantial Norman remains and a l00 ft high tower built about l443. The living was in the gift of the Jolliffe family who became Roman Catholic a generation ago. Kilmersdon has not had a vicar of its own since l976. The living is held in plurality with Radstock. Attendance is variable but the church still has an important part in village life and supported well financially even by those who rarely attend. Kilmersdon and Babington Parishes united in l978, but numbers at St Margarets are now so few that only occassional services are held there. Kilmersdon is fortunate in its vicar, but the loss of a resident incumbent is still felt keenly. Other denominations go outside the area.
